Ensembl Annotations

Fetch annotations from AnnotationHub using the ensembldb package. This function defaults to obtaining the latest annotations, unless the release argument is set to a numeric version (e.g. 88).

annotable(object, ...)

# S4 method for character
annotable(object, format = "gene",
  release = "current")

Arguments

object

Object. Default usage is to provide Ensembl genome build as a string.
...

Additional arguments (for the S4 generic definition).
format

Desired table format, either gene, tx2gene, or gene2symbol.
release

Ensembl release version. This function defaults to using the most current release available on AnnotationHub (current).

Value

data.frame with unique rows per gene or transcript.

See also

  • AnnotationHub.

  • ensembldb.

Other Gene Annotation Utilities: detectOrganism, gene2symbolFromGFF, gene2symbol, symbol2gene, tx2geneFromGFF, tx2gene

Examples

annotable("Mus musculus") %>%
    str()
#> Obtaining Ensembl annotations with AnnotationHub and ensembldb
#> /Users/mike//.AnnotationHub
#> snapshotDate(): 2017-09-07
#> EnsDB: Mus musculus Ensembl 90
#> 'data.frame':	53110 obs. of  5 variables:
#>  $ ensgene    : chr  "ENSMUSG00000000001" "ENSMUSG00000000003" "ENSMUSG00000000028" "ENSMUSG00000000031" ...
#>  $ symbol     : chr  "Gnai3" "Pbsn" "Cdc45" "H19" ...
#>  $ description: chr  "guanine nucleotide binding protein (G protein), alpha inhibiting 3 [Source:MGI Symbol;Acc:MGI:95773]" "probasin [Source:MGI Symbol;Acc:MGI:1860484]" "cell division cycle 45 [Source:MGI Symbol;Acc:MGI:1338073]" "H19, imprinted maternally expressed transcript [Source:MGI Symbol;Acc:MGI:95891]" ...
#>  $ biotype    : chr  "protein_coding" "protein_coding" "protein_coding" "lincRNA" ...
#>  $ broadClass : chr  "coding" "coding" "coding" "noncoding" ...
